intro: Browallia lactea, commonly known as the milky browallia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Browallia lactea is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
